import_type.question: What do you want to import?

device.question: What device is CrewLu installed on?

data_source_device.question: What device will you be getting the data from?

apple_id_check.question: Are you signed into the same Apple ID as your iPhone?

crewmember_type.question: What type of crewmember import do you want to do?

options.label: All Crewmembers on your aircraft type

source.question: Where is your schedule data coming from?

fullroster-iphone-iphone.title: Import Full Roster from iPhone to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-ipad-ipad.title: Import Full Roster from iPad to iPad

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the iPad. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-ipad-iphone.title: Import Full Roster from iPhone to iPad

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access on your iPhone and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.

Open Crewlu on your iPad and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-iphone-ipad.title: Import Full Roster from iPad to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access on your iPad and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.

Select the trips. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the iPad. As long as the word Roster on the top is selected, all of the trips under and above will also be selected.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.

Open Crewlu on your iPhone and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

fullroster-iphone-efk-no.title: Import Full Roster from EFK to iPhone (Different Apple IDs)
fullroster-iphone-efk-no.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and expand all the arrows of all present and future trips, then we will airdrop the roster to your device.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/42850865184a465b8dd8e5b309b338c0

media.caption: Airdrop installation screen
Airdrop settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Roster. Expand every arrow in your current and future trips. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete trip details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add AirDrop to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Make sure your airdrop is set to everyone on both devices. Select the Share button and tap Airdrop To CrewLu. Accept the permissions if any come up. A second view will come up and you need to select the blue Airdrop button this time.

media.caption: Select Airdrop To CrewLu from the share menu
Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

steps.text: Select your iPhone from the AirDrop list. Your EFK will now prepare and send the roster page to your iPhone. Accept it and it will open a text document. On the bottom it will say Crewlu. Select that and it will open Crewlu and populate the text in the Import box. Just select import and you are done.

media.caption: Accept the AirDrop transfer on your iPhone
Tap the CrewLu button at the bottom to open the app

fullroster-iphone-mac.title: Import Full Roster from Mac to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Expand all of the arrows of the trips you want to import.
Select all the text using Cmd+A.
Copy using Cmd+C.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

Tap Import and accept the prompts.

onetrip-iphone-iphone.title: Import One Trip from iPhone to iPhone
onetrip-iphone-iphone.summary: This method should mainly be used if you want your credit listed. Otherwise, there is no advantage from using the full-roster method. If the trip does not exist, it will be imported with the Credit, but there will be no additional crewmembers. If the trip is already imported, the only change will be that the Credit will be added or updated.

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Roster.
Select details or the trip number to open the individual trip view.
Select the trip. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

crewmembers-all.title: Import All Crewmembers on Your Aircraft Type

steps.text: Download the cover page of the bid package from the CMS website.
Open and select all the crew members.
Copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Open the CrewLu app on your device.
Tap the Pilot icon on the top right of the apps starting view, this will open the Pilot Information view. Scroll down to the box that says, "Upload Pilots"
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. Then tap "Parse Pilot Data". Then tap Ok. Next tap "Preview 262 Pilots".
Select the pilots you want to add to the app, or just Add them all. When done you can go back to Pilot Information view to look through the pilot directory.
If you'd like to add a photo and crewmember contact information, use the "Import Individual Crewmember" method and it will merge the crewmembers information.

crewmembers-individual.title: Import Individual Crewmember
crewmembers-individual.summary: This method will import a photo and contact details for the crewmember into the app.

steps.text: Find crewmember on the IPA app and take a screenshot of the person.
Select the share button and select Crewlu.
This should have opened the CrewLu app and you should select Add This Pilot or update information.

onetrip-iphone-efk-no.title: Import One Trip from EFK to iPhone (Different Apple IDs)
onetrip-iphone-efk-no.summary: This method should mainly be used if you want your credit listed. Otherwise, there is no advantage from using the full-roster method. If the trip does not exist, it will be imported with the Credit, but there will be no additional crewmembers. If the trip is already imported, the only change will be that the Credit will be added or updated. This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and select the individual trip, then we will airdrop the trip to your device.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/42850865184a465b8dd8e5b309b338c0

media.caption: Airdrop installation screen
Airdrop settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Select details or the trip number. This will open a new window that shows the individual trip.
Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add AirDrop to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Make sure your airdrop is set to everyone on both devices. Select the Share button and tap Airdrop To CrewLu. Accept the permissions if any come up. A second view will come up and you need to select the blue Airdrop button this time.

media.caption: Select Airdrop To CrewLu from the share menu
Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

steps.text: Select your iPhone from the AirDrop list. Your EFK will now prepare and send the roster page to your iPhone. Accept it and it will open a text document. On the bottom it will say Crewlu. Select that and it will open Crewlu and populate the text in the Import box. Just select import and you are done.

media.caption: Accept the AirDrop transfer on your iPhone
Tap the CrewLu button at the bottom to open the app

onetrip-iphone-efk-yes.summary: This method should mainly be used if you want your credit listed. Otherwise, there is no advantage from using the full-roster method. steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/42850865184a465b8dd8e5b309b338c0

media.caption: Airdrop installation screen
Airdrop settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Select details or the trip number. This will open a new window that shows the individual trip.
Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add AirDrop to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Make sure your airdrop is set to everyone on both devices. Select the Share button and tap Airdrop To CrewLu. Accept the permissions if any come up. A second view will come up and you need to select the blue Airdrop button this time.

media.caption: Select Airdrop To CrewLu from the share menu
Tap the blue Airdrop button on the second prompt

steps.text: Select your iPad from the AirDrop list. Your EFK will now prepare and send the roster page to your iPad. Accept it and it will open a text document. On the bottom it will say Crewlu. Select that and it will open Crewlu and populate the text in the Import box. Just select import and you are done.

media.caption: Accept the AirDrop transfer on your iPad
Tap the CrewLu button at the bottom to open the app

deadhead-iphone-iphone.title: Import Jumpseat from iPhone to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Jumpseats.
Expand all of the arrows of the jumpseats you want to import.
Select the jumpseats. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the phone.
Tap the word Copy.
Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

deadhead-iphone-ipad.title: Import Jumpseat from iPad to iPhone

steps.text: Sign in to Crew Access and select Jumpseats.
Expand all of the arrows of the jumpseats you want to import.

Select the jumpseats. The best way I've found is to scroll to the bottom and hold your finger on the bottom most right text. Then hold the left corner and drag to the top of the iPad. As long as the word Jumpseats on the top is selected, all of the jumpseats under and above will also be selected.

Tap the blue cloud icon in the bottom right, then tap the clipboard. Then tap Copy to isolation. Make sure there is text in the box or you did something wrong.
Open Crewlu and hit the + sign in the top right of the Trip list view. Tap Paste. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap Import and accept the prompts.

deadhead-efk.title: Import Jumpseat on EFK
deadhead-efk.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your jumpseats and expand all the arrows of all present and future jumpseats, then we will use the shortcut to import the jumpseat.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/1c4eea69ff5e4130b05eb8d6ac28f99d

media.caption: Shortcut installation screen
Shortcut settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your jumpseats page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Jumpseats. Expand every arrow in your current and future jumpseats. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete jumpseat details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Select the Share button and use the shortcut. Accept any permissions that come up.

media.caption: Select the shortcut from the share menu
Follow the prompts

steps.text: Your EFK will now prepare the jumpseat page. The data will be copied to your clipboard and ready to paste into CrewLu. Open CrewLu and paste in the Import box, then select import and you are done.

media.caption: Data is prepared and copied
Open CrewLu and paste to import

fullroster-efk.title: Import Full Roster on EFK
fullroster-efk.summary: This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and expand all the arrows of all present and future trips, then we will use the shortcut to import the roster.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Navigate to your Crew Access Roster. Expand every arrow in your current and future trips. It won't get imported if it can't be seen.

media.caption: Expand all arrows to show complete trip details

steps.text: Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Select the Share button and tap the Clipboard to CrewLu shortcut. Accept any permissions that come up.
Your EFK will now prepare the roster page. The data will be copied to your clipboard and ready to paste into CrewLu. Open CrewLu and paste in the Import box, then select import and you are done.

onetrip-efk.title: Import One Trip on EFK
onetrip-efk.summary: This method should mainly be used if you want your credit listed. Otherwise, there is no advantage from using the full-roster method. If the trip does not exist, it will be imported with the Credit, but there will be no additional crewmembers. If the trip is already imported, the only change will be that the Credit will be added or updated. This method will use safari on your efk. You must be signed in to Zscaler in order for Safari to show your schedule. You need to add a shortcut to your efk, then go to your roster and select the individual trip, then we will use the shortcut to import the trip.

steps.text: On your EFK go to settings, then Apps, then select Shortcuts.

media.caption: Navigate to Shortcuts in Settings

steps.text: Select Advanced

media.caption: Tap on Advanced in the Shortcuts settings

steps.text: Make sure Allow Running Scripts is on

media.caption: Enable Allow Running Scripts toggle

steps.text: Open this url on your efk and add this shortcut. https://www.icloud.com/shortcuts/1c4eea69ff5e4130b05eb8d6ac28f99d

media.caption: Shortcut installation screen
Shortcut settings configuration

steps.text: Open the flightops.inside.ups.com website in safari on your efk. This only works in SAFARI. Select the share button on the top right and select "Add to Home Screen".

media.caption: Open Safari and navigate to your roster page

steps.text: Select details or the trip number. This will open a new window that shows the individual trip.
Select the Share button on the top right and select Edit Actions and then add to favorites.

media.caption: Select Edit Actions from the Share menu
Add to favorites for quick access

steps.text: Almost done. Select the Share button and tap the Clipboard to CrewLu shortcut. Accept any permissions that come up.
Your EFK will now prepare the trip page. The data will be copied to your clipboard and ready to paste into CrewLu. Open CrewLu and paste in the Import box, then select import and you are done.

tripboard-iphone-iphone.title: Import TripBoard from iPhone to iPhone
tripboard-iphone-iphone.summary: Importing using this method is not as complete as Crew Access method. And this app is in no way associated with Bidpro.

steps.text: Open a trip on TripBoard on the web or on the Bidpro app.
Select all the text, then tap Copy.
Paste into the CrewLu app. Wow that was easy!

altour_ticket-iphone-iphone.title: Import Altour Ticket from iPhone to iPhone
altour_ticket-iphone-iphone.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

steps.text: Open the Mail app and locate the email containing your Altour ticket information.
Tap and hold on the ticket data, then tap 'Select All' to highlight all relevant information.
Tap 'Copy' to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

altour_ticket-iphone-ipad.title: Import Altour Ticket from iPad to iPhone
altour_ticket-iphone-ipad.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

steps.text: On your iPad, open the Mail app and locate the email containing your Altour ticket information.
Tap and hold on the ticket data, then tap 'Select All' to highlight all relevant information.
Tap 'Copy' to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Transfer the copied data to your iPhone using AirDrop, Messages, Notes, or iCloud clipboard (Universal Clipboard).
On your iPhone, open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

altour_ticket-iphone-mac.title: Import Altour Ticket from Mac to iPhone
altour_ticket-iphone-mac.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

steps.text: On your Mac, open the Mail app and locate the email containing your Altour ticket information.
Click and drag to select all relevant ticket data, or press Cmd+A to select all.
Press Cmd+C to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Transfer the copied data to your iPhone using AirDrop, Messages, Notes, or iCloud clipboard (Universal Clipboard).
On your iPhone, open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

altour_ticket-ipad-iphone.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

steps.text: On your iPhone, open the Mail app and locate the email containing your Altour ticket information.
Tap and hold on the ticket data, then tap 'Select All' to highlight all relevant information.
Tap 'Copy' to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Transfer the copied data to your iPad using AirDrop, Messages, Notes, or iCloud clipboard (Universal Clipboard).
On your iPad, open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

altour_ticket-ipad-ipad.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

altour_ticket-ipad-mac.title: Import Altour Ticket from Mac to iPad
altour_ticket-ipad-mac.summary: Important: Importing your Altour ticket will enhance your flight details. For 'As Scheduled' tickets, the information will be added to your existing flight's detail view. For non-scheduled flights, a separate trip will be created.

steps.text: On your Mac, open the Mail app and locate the email containing your Altour ticket information.
Click and drag to select all relevant ticket data, or press Cmd+A to select all.
Press Cmd+C to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Transfer the copied data to your iPad using AirDrop, Messages, Notes, or iCloud clipboard (Universal Clipboard).
On your iPad, open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

catering-iphone-iphone.title: Import Catering from iPhone to iPhone

steps.text: Open the Mail app and locate the email containing your catering information.
Tap and hold on the catering data, then tap 'Select All' to highlight all relevant information.
Tap 'Copy' to copy the selected text to your clipboard.
Open the CrewLu app and tap the + sign in the top right corner of the Trip List view.
Tap 'Paste' to insert the copied data into the import field. You don't need to select an import method. The app will know and show you after you hit the paste button.
Tap 'Import' to complete the process.

Tap 'Import' to complete the process.
